title: Authors and Citation
text: Esther Herbert. Maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Herbert E (2024). Minimisation Multi-Arm Trials. https://github.com/EstherHerbert/multimini.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Minimisation For Multi-Arm Trials},   author = {Esther Herbert},   url = {https://github.com/EstherHerbert/multimini},   year = {2024}, }

title: Minimisation For Multi-Arm Trials
text: goal multimini use minimisation randomise multi-arm trial various different techniques minimisation probabilities.

title: Minimisation For Multi-Arm Trials
text: can install development version multimini GitHub :

title: Minimisation For Multi-Arm Trials
code: library(multimini)  (mini <- minimise(patients, groups = 3, factors = c("sex", "stage"),                    burnin = 15)) #> Multi-arm Minimisation  #> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- #> Groups: A B C  #> Randomisation ratio: 1:1:1  #> Factors: sex, stage  #> Burnin: 15  #> Minimisation probability: 0.8  #> Group sizes: 50, 50, 50  balance(mini) #> Balance of factors (sex, stage) over ABC groups (1:1:1) #> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- #> |   |  F|  M|    |   |  I| II| III| #> |:--|--:|--:|    |:--|--:|--:|---:| #> |A  | 24| 26|    |A  | 26| 15|   9| #> |B  | 23| 27|    |B  | 26| 15|   9| #> |C  | 23| 27|    |C  | 25| 16|   9| #>  #> Total imbalance: 2.309

title: Minimisation For Multi-Arm Trials
code: new.patients <- data.frame(  sex = c("F", "F", "M"),  stage = c("II","I", "I"),  site = c(9, 9, 1) )  update(mini, new.patients)  #> Multi-arm Minimisation  #> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- #> Groups: A B C  #> Randomisation ratio: 1:1:1  #> Factors: sex, stage  #> Burnin: 15  #> Minimisation probability: 0.8  #> Group sizes: 53, 50, 50

title: Get balance of minimisation — balance
text: Get balance minimisation randomisation

title: Get balance of minimisation — balance
text: object object class mini

title: Get balance of minimisation — balance
text: object class balance.mini

title: Get balance of minimisation — balance
code: # Minimisation to 3 groups, with two factors and a burnin of 15 mini <- minimise(patients, groups = 3, factors = c("sex", "stage"),                  burnin = 15)  balance(mini) #> Balance of factors (sex, stage) over ABC groups (1:1:1) #> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- #> |   |  F|  M|    |   |  I| II| III| #> |:--|--:|--:|    |:--|--:|--:|---:| #> |A  | 25| 25|    |A  | 29| 13|   8| #> |B  | 25| 25|    |B  | 27| 14|   9| #> |C  | 26| 24|    |C  | 31| 13|   6| #>  #> Total imbalance: 5.26

title: Minimisation for a dataset — minimise
text: minimise randomises patients data frame using minimisation

title: Minimisation for a dataset — minimise
code: minimise(   data,   groups = 3,   factors,   burnin = 10,   minprob = 0.8,   ratio = rep(1, groups),   group.names = NULL,   seed = NULL,   check.eligibility = FALSE )

title: Minimisation for a dataset — minimise
text: data data.frame object one line per participant columns minimisation factors. also possible pass empty data.frame order set minimisation later use update.mini(). groups integer, number groups randomise , default 3 factors character vector factors minimisation burnin integer, burnin length minimisation kicks , default 10. Must > 0. minprob minimisation probability. default give 0.8 probability group lead least imbalance. ratio numeric vector randomisation ratios ascending order (must length equal number groups) group.names optional, character vector group names, must length groups. seed optional, integer used set.seed() offsetting random number generator. check.eligibility logical indicating whether participants varying eligibility different groups. TRUE column eligible exist data.

title: Minimisation for a dataset — minimise
text: (Invisibly) data.frame additional column Group indicating group allocated.

title: Minimisation for a dataset — minimise
code: # Minimisation to 3 groups, with two factors and a burnin of 15, using the # patients data from the package (mini <- minimise(patients, groups = 3, factors = c("sex", "stage"),                   burnin = 15)) #> Multi-arm Minimisation  #> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- #> Groups: A B C  #> Randomisation ratio: 1:1:1  #> Factors: sex, stage  #> Burnin: 15  #> Minimisation probability: 0.8  #> Group sizes: 52, 48, 50   # View data with group info as.data.frame(mini) #>     sex stage site eligible Group #> 1     M    II    6  A, B, C     C #> #> 148   M    II    2  A, B, C     A #> 149   M     I    3  A, B, C     C #> 150   F     I    5  A, B, C     C  # Use 1:1:2 ratio minimise(patients, groups = 3, factors = c("sex", "stage"), burnin = 5,          ratio = c(1,1,2)) #> Multi-arm Minimisation  #> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- #> Groups: A B C  #> Randomisation ratio: 1:1:2  #> Factors: sex, stage  #> Burnin: 5  #> Minimisation probability: 0.8  #> Group sizes: 39, 37, 74   # Account for different group eligibility minimise(patients, groups = 3, factors = c("sex", "stage"), burnin = 5,          ratio = c(1,1,2), check.eligibility = TRUE) #> Multi-arm Minimisation  #> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- #> Groups: A B C  #> Randomisation ratio: 1:1:2  #> Factors: sex, stage  #> Burnin: 5  #> Minimisation probability: 0.8  #> Group sizes: 42, 37, 71

title: multimini: Minimisation For Multi-Arm Trials — multimini-package
text: Minimisation multi-arm trials various methods minimisation probabilities.

title: Randomly Generated Patient Data — patients
text: randomly generated data set "patient" data

title: Randomly Generated Patient Data — patients
text: data frame 150 rows 4 columns: sex Patient sex (M F) stage Stage disease (, II, III) site Recruitment site (1 10) eligible treatments eligible ? (, B, C)

what: Plots to explore minimisation results — plot.mini
title: Plots to explore minimisation results — plot.mini
text: Plots explore minimisation results

title: Plots to explore minimisation results — plot.mini
code: # S3 method for class 'mini' plot(x, show.plot = TRUE, ...)

title: Plots to explore minimisation results — plot.mini
text: x object class mini result minimises nrow(x) > 0. show.plot logical; FALSE plot displayed, useful assigning plot future use. ... parameters passed plotting functions.

what: Simulate data for minimisation simulations — simulate_data
title: Simulate data for minimisation simulations — simulate_data
text: Given list factors specified levels proportions, sample size, function simulates data use simulate_mini().

title: Simulate data for minimisation simulations — simulate_data
code: simulate_data(sampsize, factors, eligibility = FALSE, groups = NULL)

title: Simulate data for minimisation simulations — simulate_data
text: sampsize desired sample size data, .e., sample size prospective trial. factors list factors, list containing two items. first levels either vector level names number levels. second item either props, vector proportions equal number levels factor; prop.dist named vector containing mean sd proportions. eligibility logical, data include group eligibility. TRUE must supply groups argument. groups either character vector group names integer specifying number groups.

title: Simulate data for minimisation simulations — simulate_data
Simulation of minimisation — simulate_mini
text: simulate_mini repeatedly generates random data minimises different specified burnin periods /minimisation probabilities. purpose guide decisions designing randomisation strategy randomised controlled trial.

title: Simulation of minimisation — simulate_mini
code: simulate_mini(   sampsize,   factors,   eligibility = FALSE,   Nsims = 100,   groups = 3,   burnin,   minprob,   ratio = rep(1, groups) )

title: Simulation of minimisation — simulate_mini
text: sampsize desired sample size data, .e., sample size prospective trial. factors list factors, list containing two items. first levels either vector level names number levels. second item either props, vector proportions equal number levels factor; prop.dist named vector containing mean sd proportions. eligibility logical, data include group eligibility. TRUE must supply groups argument. Nsims integer, number simulations run per scenario, default 100. groups integer, number groups randomise, default 3. burnin vector integers possible burnin lengths minimisation kicks . Individual values must > 0 < total sample size. minprob vector possible minimisation probabilities. ratio numeric vector randomisation ratios (must length equal number groups).

what: Update a minimisation with new data — update.mini
title: Update a minimisation with new data — update.mini
text: update updates minimisation new participant data, using existing group allocations factor information allocate new participants using minimisation.

title: Update a minimisation with new data — update.mini
code: # S3 method for class 'mini' update(object, new.data, ...)

title: Update a minimisation with new data — update.mini
text: object object class mini, .e., resulting minimise() new.data data.frame object one line per new participant columns minimisation factors. Must format data.frame object (minus Group) ... unused arguments passed update.default()

title: Update a minimisation with new data — update.mini
text: (Invisibly) data.frame participants group existing new group allocations

title: Update a minimisation with new data — update.mini
code: mini <- minimise(patients, groups = 3, factors = c("sex", "stage"),                  burnin = 10)  new.patients <- data.frame(   sex = c("F", "F", "M"),   stage = c("II","I", "I"),   site = c(9, 9, 1) )  update(mini, new.patients) #> Multi-arm Minimisation  #> -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- #> Groups: A B C  #> Randomisation ratio: 1:1:1  #> Factors: sex, stage  #> Burnin: 10  #> Minimisation probability: 0.8  #> Group sizes: 53, 50, 50
